Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: redlemon19
Reviews.Content: What I liked: 10 min walk from the airport shuttle, I walked late at night - very safe and well lit. Friendliest English speaking staff. Clean, good sleep quality if room faces the yard. Low budget but enough breakfast. Did not like: no elevator in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, close to station, perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: Amy D
Reviews.Content: This was literally two streets from the train station. We stayed on the first floor (there is no lift). Rooms are cleaned daily, checkout is 11am. Breakfast is included but is nothing special. Croissants, bread rolls, cereal and juice. No toast or eggs or yoghurt or fruit that I've seen at other places. Staff were helpful with information about Venice and spoke good English. The room was comfortable, free wifi, not fancy but I would definitely stay there again. So close to the station, it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jianina A
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located close to railway station and not far from Piazzale Roma bus station. Room and bathroom small, old but clean. Rates good considering it's Venice which is very touristy and was during the Carnival festivities. Breakfast was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kamema
Reviews.Content: It is very close to the railway station and in the heart of everything. For Venice we thought it was good value for money. The rooms are tiny and old but clean and air conditioned and you are only there to sleep, so for us it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TinkaK
Reviews.Content: This 2 star hotel is very close to public transport (main train station & waterbuses) and is near the well-known Jewish Ghetto area, a quieter, more vibrant area than the pricey San Marco region. Our main gripes about this hotel would be the bugs (vinegar flies) at breakfast time and the showers (we had the shared bathroom option). Considering Venice is surrounded by water, very little of it came out of our shower! Overall, we weren't expecting the Ritz so we found it ok. The rooms were cleaned and we had fresh towels every day, the staff were also polite. The simple fact is Venice is â‚¬â‚¬â‚¬â‚¬!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: PHFM
Reviews.Content: This is a ** star hotel. So you get: - classic Italian plumbing (no water if your neighbour is showering) - a room barely big enough for the bed - no English channels on TV but you also get - a convenient location - pleasant staff - cleanliness So go for it. I did and I was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: meips
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near the train station and can be easily located. However, they do not have a lift in the hotel and we had to carry our luggage two floors up without the help of the hotel staff. The staircase is quite narrow and steep. Room is very small for three people and one of the beds is foldable bed with a thin mattress. Breakfast place is small for the number of hotel guests they accomodate, hence guests would need to squeeze to have their breakfast or even queue to wait for their turn to be sitted. The breakfast is very limited. The female hotel staff is not friendly when we asked a question and were taken aback by the hostile response when she provided us. Thankfully, not all of the hotel staff are the same as some of them are more willing to help us out in our enquiries about the public transport to the airport. Overall this hotel is ok with it's good points of being located near the train station, free wifi and located near the river taxi stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lorij123
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Florida. Overall it was a good experience. We were looking for an inexpensive hotel, which is hard to find in Venice. The Hotel Florida is 1 alley away from the train station, and for us was a great location. We didn't have to drag our luggage too far and the vaparettos and water taxis stop a 1/2 block away. The area is fairly congested though. The hotel is in an old building, no elevator for luggage. So getting our bags up and down those narrow stairs was a bit of a work out, but we'd expected that. The front desk is manned 24 hours which is great. The free wi fi worked well on the 2nd floor which we all appreciated. We were a group of 8, 2 rooms of 3 and 1 double. The rooms are a bit small, but clean and the bathrooms I saw had been re-tiled recently. They had nice showers and plenty of hot water. It was HOT in Sept but the a/c worked so we left the windows closed. Not much of a view on the back side of the hotel, but that was OK. The breakfast room is really tiny, and though it was included in the cost of the room, we only had breakfast there once. (Though we did stop there a couple of afternoons an buy a cold beer.)The coffee was pretty terrible and breakfast was just a roll & yogurt. We ended up going around the corner to Restaurant Brek for cappuchino & fresh crossants most mornings. The have a crossant with sprinkles on it that is filled with Nutella...mmmm! The lady at the front desk was helpful getting us an early taxi the morning we departed. We had to be at the airport by 6 am. We wanted a water taxi but couldn't get anyone to agree to pick us up at 5:30 am. So we ended up with a van. Though the driver had an arrangement with someone who works at the train station. He drove over in this little electric buggy and pick up all our luggage. Then we followed him through a back gate behind the train station to where the taxi waited for us, so we didn't have to drag out luggage up over the bridge into the taxi parking lot. It was pricey, but actually worth it.

Reviews.Title: “AC did not work”
Reviews.Author: StephanieBarski
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, right by the train station and ferry. Great restaurants near by. I am giving this an average rating because the AC in our room BARELY worked. We were in Venice in August, so the temperature was very hot! We left the AC running all night and it never cooled down. During breakfast the next day, we heard other guest complaining that their AC's were not working either and their rooms were uncomfortably hot. We complained to the person at the front desk, and they offered a different room, but we refused because everyone else was complaining about their rooms, too. One lady in particular was rude, saying that our AC not working is not that bad, that "WAR IS TERRIBLE, this is not terrible!" When I tried to sit in the breakfast room to cool off, they made me get out (I do not know why...) Anyways, when we came back that evening, they had left a card in the wall to keep the AC running and it had cooled off a bit, much better than it had been. The location was great, and the bathrooms were nice (there was actually a tub!) The staff was on the rude side.

Reviews.Title: “basic but good location”
Reviews.Author: Eranda_11
Reviews.Content: well....its a basic hotel but very close to train station. 20min to airport. too expensive for two star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay again, would NOT recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Cdn77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is almost right next to the train station. Itâ€™s so easy to get to, thereâ€™s no crossing bridges with heavy luggage, no battling with cobblestone, etc. That is a definite bonus. We were in Room 7 and were there for 4 days in August. When you leave the hotel, you leave your key at the front, there is always someone there. The room has no alarm clock, but they have wake up calls. No big deal â€“ none of the rooms we stayed in during our trip had alarm clocks. The hotel is located right on top of a seafood restaurant. Iâ€™m guessing that depending on which direction your room faces, this may or may not affect you. If you face the laneway, this very much affects you. This VERY much affected us. Every night we could hear â€“ very clearly â€“ conversations, dishes clanging, etc. After the restaurant closed, they would drag their heavy tables and chairs along the pavement inside and close up shop. Once that was quiet, we heard only the noises of loud teenagers that often walk up this alleyway to go wherever it is they all hang out. The windows of this hotel do absolutely nothing to block out any noise at all, it was like sleeping with them open. Once it is quiet enough for you to sleep â€“ around 1am, you fall asleep for a few hours, only to be awoken at 7am by the bells of the church next door. They were SO loud. And it wasnâ€™t a quick chime, everybody up and in church. No, it rang 200+ times. We counted one morning. Why not, we werenâ€™t busy sleeping. We were so frustrated and fed up with this room after our first night, I considered switching hotels. As for the room, itâ€™s very tiny. My suitcase sat atop the luggage rack. The only place for boyfriends was in front of the door. Handy, should we need to leave. There were no English channels on TV other than the BBC. Not a big deal I know, but when we are spending some down time in our room, it would be nice to have CNN to watch to know whatâ€™s going on in North America. It didnâ€™t matter either way, we may not have heard the TV over the noise from the restaurant. The shower curtain did nothing to stop water from getting on the floor. We gave up and just let it, soaking the bath mats until they were replaced. The bed was comfortable. What little sleep we did get, at least we had that. The breakfast room was very small, often there was a lineup of people waiting for a table. And there was only one poor girl working the whole room. The selection wasnâ€™t very good. They had cereal, croissants, coffee and yoghurt that they placed underneath a lamp every morning â€“ made no sense, it was like a heat lamp. Isnâ€™t yoghurt supposed to be cold?? They have a computer in the breakfast room that guests can use for free for 30 minutes per day per room. As long as no one else is waiting to use it though, you can stay on longer and they donâ€™t say much. We left for the airport at 6am, and the one guy at the front desk, Emmanuelle, was a total sweetheart. He packed us a breakfast to take with us. It was such a sweet gesture. He should be working in a 5 star, not in a little dive like this place. I would not recommend this hotel and I would not stay here again. If you are visiting Venice, you are surely interested in the Gondolas. Here was our experience and why I will never speak kindly of them: There were 4 of us and we agreed we would do 80 euro for 25-30 minutes. We asked a couple gondoliers and finally found one who agreed to 25 minutes for 80 euro. He pointed out things here and there, commentated a little bit and seemed to be a nice guy. I didnâ€™t get a bad vibe from him, though after the fact, some in my group said they did. We were smart enough to check our watches when we left so when he returned us to his dock after 18 minutes, we said you owe us another 7 minutes. He said â€˜I told you 20-25 minutes.â€™ Ok a) you said 25 and b) even if you had said 20-25, it hasnâ€™t been either. None of us enjoy being ripped off and were being sticklers, we had every right to be if he wasnâ€™t going to keep up his end of the deal. He got an attitude real quick so we got one right back. I couldnâ€™t believe how arrogant and rude he was. At one point he said â€˜this isnâ€™t a motor boat.â€™ Then he said fine, you want 5 minutes? and proceeded to pull back out of his docking area and sit right down on his deck and look at us. I think he realized though he would get in trouble if anyone saw him so he stood up and kept us in place in the middle of the river while big boats went right by us. He was being totally lazy and trying to rip us off, but it took more effort for him to maintain and keep us steady just sitting there in the middle of the river. Look at the attached photo, donâ€™t get in this guys gondolier, if you must do the gondolas at all. I didnâ€™t think it was worth it at all, even if the guy wasnâ€™t rude, itâ€™s such a tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing good about this hotel is the location”
Reviews.Author: MandWS-MN
Reviews.Content: This is an older, basic property with almost no amenities. The air conditioner was almost non-existent and we had to borrow a fan from the front desk to make the room tolerable (still very uncomfortable). They don't even provide a hair dryer in the bathroom and no shampoo... There was mold in the shower and ants all over the room and hotel. The free breakfast was the sadest one we experienced in a 10 day vaction in northern Italy (we found flies and ants crawling everywhere in the breakfast room). On the positive side, the location is excellent as it is literally 5 minutes from the train station and has a water bus stop right off its street. But other than that there is little else positive to say about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service though a bit cramp.”
Reviews.Author: Canbasher
Reviews.Content: Easy access to the termini, vaporetto, shops and food, this hotel has prime location. For our group of four, we got the quad room but it still felt small though maybe thats to be expected for Venice. This was the 3rd hotel in our 4 city vacation and compared to Rome and Florence, it was the smallest. The air conditioning unit seemed a bit weak at first and took a while to cool but it worked ok. Wifi worked well. Front desk was helpful, friendly and courteous. They stored our luggage all day for our late train out. We were out most of the day so the hotel was adequate for sleep and showers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good hotel for on a budget”
Reviews.Author: ALeJune
Reviews.Content: As getting around Venice includes a lot of steps and going over bridges, this hotel was a great choice and it's right around the corner from the Santa Lucia train station. We arrived to Venice via train and were so glad that the hotel was within walking distance and we didn't have to mess with the ordeal of taking a water taxi and wandering around narrow streets through Venice carrying luggage to find our hotel. The hotel is down a small alleyway across from the Ponte degli Scalzi. The hotel room was decent sized with a queen size bed and a clean bathroom. The room did have an AC, although it wasn't as cool as I would have liked, it was also 30 degrees in mid July in Venice so I can't complain too much!! The included breakfast was normal with a selection of pastries and coffee. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with any questions we had about getting around Venice! I think the best thing about this hotel was the location...getting around Venice on water taxi is easy, but as it is crowded, walking around with luggage can be a pain, so being able to get out of the train station and get to the hotel rather quickly was completely ideal! If you are going to Venice to sight see and want to stay somewhere convienient on a budget then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel - very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: AbbieKate_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. It had very polite staff and included breakfast which was also lovely. The rooms were spacious and clean with a t.v. which had the BBC news channel. Only negative is that it is slightly far from the centre but it was do-able and better then paying more for something similar closer in!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyG33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just minutes from the train station and the vaporetto stop. Is is about 5 minutes from great shopping and restaurants. We had A/C and WiFi, but no lift. The lobby is very tiny, but the staff is friendly and helpful. They will store luggage if you arrive early or leave late. We had a triple room, which was large and tastefully decorated. The twin bed was a bit lumpy, but my mom slept OK. Breakfast was not great, but adequate. I want to return to Venice, and i will definitely stay here again. You just can't ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but great location”
Reviews.Author: tinabenesch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located pretty close to the train station and boy were we glad we were not hauling our luggage around Venice. Located on a side street, we had no noise in our room. The staff was helpful in getting our air conditioning going, and also in loaning us an adapter for our camera and kindles. Good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Adequate Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gina-G78
Reviews.Content: The fact that this hotel is Very Close to the train station is wonderful! Because in Venice you cant just toss your luggage in a cab and head there. Everyone knows that Venice is crowded, this coupled with cobble streets makes walking anywhere with luggage an absolute beating. There is one bridge you have to cross to get there, but really not too bad if you are able bodied. The hotel is located in a tiny alley (not scary) so finding it can be tough- just get good directions by calling first. They always had someone at the desk who was very fluent in English (big plus). Rooms were small, ac decent, nothing fancy. It was right for the price. Yes- Id stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station”
Reviews.Author: happycat22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights the end of June. The location was great, we got to the hotel in no time, no hills to drag luggage. The airconditioning was not too great, luckily there was a nice breeze so we normally kept our windows open. There was no elevator here, so we had to carry our bags up one flight of stairs. The breakfast was ok, nothing different from other hotels. We were able to walk everywhere in Venice. There was always someone at the desk, even when we got back to our room at 3:00am! They will hold your luggage here also, so you can enjoy Venice until your train leaves.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: yosh00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Florida for 4 nights. it is a bit pricy for the most basic accommodation. Generally its is about the average one would be expected to pay in Venice. Rooms and bathrooms are really tiny. however they were very clean. Linen is changed everday. Breakfast is basic, but more than adequate to start you off. Internet is free. The bar service is not grand though.The best thing about this hotel is the fantastic location. its a minute walk from the main train station and water bus. We arrived at marco polo airport and took a bus to the main bus stop(45 mins), and then a 7 minute walk to the hotel. it was super easy! the hotel is situated just in an alley way off the main shopping street in Venice. Avoid at all cost eating at the AI SCALZI restaurant, in front of the alley leading to the hotel. This resturant is a total rip off and the food is below average. The guy incharge (who seems to be the owner) had actually double charged us, and claimed it was an error. Only later did other friends have the exact same issue. Rather walk further down to excellent resturants. all in all i would definetly stay at hotel Florida again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: akhe83
Reviews.Content: My main three criteria were location, price and reviews. When i found this place i immediately decided to book it for 3 nights. The hotel was easy to find, near by the train station and when we checked in we had a quite good impression about it. The staff was friendly especially the lady at the reception. She gave us really good advices about things to see and visit. The breakfast was basic and it is better to get a coffee somewhere in town... The room was tiny but clean and towels/sheets were changed every morning. The only real negative point is that my girlfriend got bitten by bed bugs several time. At first we thought she had an allergy until we found the last morning 2 bed bugs on our bed. We mentioned the problem at the reception but our feeling was that they were not really concerned about it. They told us these insects might come from outside from the trees. And the only answer we got was "sorry for the inconvenience" Again...by reading some reviews the hotel doesn't look that bad and we also had a good time. We have anyway spent more time outside visiting the city. Without this accident with the bed bugs, our staying in the hotel would have been very good.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: gavingirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Florida in June 2011. The pros are that it is super easy to get to when arriving by train, the AC worked great, you can also catch the water buses just outside the hotel, and the staff is helpful. The cons are that the rooms are super tiny and it is very expensive for what you are getting. If we were to return to Venice, we would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: ariete415
Reviews.Content: This hotel was much better than I expected. There was no elevator but they had free internet. The room was large but definitely needs an update. The bathroom was small but did the job. The front desk was extremely helpful, especially Emanuele. He pointed us to an amazing mask shop nearby. It was a short walk from the train station. I highly recommend this location if you just want to get off the train and drop off luggage. It is quite a far walk to St. Mark's but it was really nice just wandering through alleys and across bridges. The Vaporetto was right there so you can take that if you don't want to walk. The breakfast was nothing special. The day we left, they were able to hold our luggage for us. Two cons: 1) It was very hot when we went and there was no air conditioning. The windows were open which gave a nice breeze but since there were no screens, I got SO many mosquito bites while I slept. 2) I slept on the twin bed and it literally caved in the middle, as if there was no support along the middle of the bed. Even with the two cons, I would still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “close to station”
Reviews.Author: ManojSureka
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel since it was walking from railway station and we got a good deal at a good price compare to other hotels in the areas. hotel and room is small but clean. anyway most of the time we are out of the hotels in these places. break fast was okay, service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location near all transportation options”
Reviews.Author: April_Mexico_bride
Reviews.Content: Hotel Florida is a very nice place to stay while you are in Venice. Its convenient location near the train and bus stations, and the vaporetto, helps you to maximize your time during your visit. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the area, they helped us find a great gondolier for our first night in Venice. Breakfast was good, and the Caffe Latte and Cappucino was excellent. There is a church nearby that rings its bells at 7:15am, but this is not a problem ifor those who are here to enjoy Venice's sites and culture, rather to sleep in late.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - better than the external look”
Reviews.Author: pabcbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days in the pre-Easter week. This must be the closest cheap hotel from Sta Lucia train station. In a narrow quiet street, with triple windows (new-ish), no noise at night. The hotel does not look like anything from outside, but inside, everything is OK (for Venice, meaning small and overpriced). The triple room had a double bed and an in-built folding bed. Bathroom was small but newly redone. Painting in room was recent. b'fast room is small and buffet is basic. Service was nice. 2star is merited.

Reviews.Title: “Two night stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: trwag260
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to the train station in Venice and Hotel Florida was perfect. Hotel is on a busy street but at night with the windows closed there was no noise. Alex at the front desk recommended ilRefolo(SP?) for dinner and the dinner was one of the best we've had in Italy.Rooms were clean and nice very happy wiht our choice.

Reviews.Title: “compact and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: anglaisenautriche
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and compfortable with a basic breakfast. Very close to the main station in Venice and we walked to Piazza San Marco from it (Venice is not that big). Only downside was that the narrow street outside our window was sometimes noisy, but was not a problem as such. Price was very reasonable compared to other available hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very close to train station, clean”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmith
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on location near to train station, room rate, and (most important) opinions on Trip Advisor. Everything was right on. There is no elevator and if you have a lot of heavy luggage you will have to haul it up (but we travel light so no problem). Why near the train station? Look at the people dragging their luggage over the arched bridges, and rough streets and onto the vaporettos, so if you travel by train this is a very good location. Also, the staff was very helpful - I think there were 3 or 4 different people at the desk during our two day stay, one at time and all were very nice. You can use their computer in the breakfast room at certain times (not during breakfast hours) for free for a while, then maybe a very low charge. They also take credit cards. Re noise, our room on the 1st floor was over a restaurant and narrow street that seemed the main route from the train station/vaporetto stop to the high school, so there was a little noise but for some reason did not bother us. Hey, it's Italy, we enjoyed looking out our window to see the passersby below.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant little gem”
Reviews.Author: pambredcar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a perfect location , only a couple of minutes from the main bridge from the mainland in to Venice and very close to the water bus station. Our room was small but very clean having recently been refurbished. we had asked for a double bed ,however got two singles pushed together. The beds were however very comfortable. The room was cleaned daily(, we stayed 5 nights ) and the linen changed regularly. The breakfast was ok as long as you like a healthy dose of carbs! The only issue we had was with the air conditioning when we asked if it could be turned up we were told no as it is controlled b the mamangement and no changes could be made.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: MarianaMatos
Reviews.Content: Hotel Florida provided me and my husband a nice stay in Venice. I've booked my reservation paying in advance to get better rates, and I definitely don't regret it. The hotel is really close to the bus stop, and on foot it's rather easy to get there. If you prefer not to walk with heavy bags (there's one bridge with steps crossing one chanel), it's also easy to get a vaporetto that leaves you in front of the hotel street. When I arrived I walked (10-15 minutes), and when I leaved I took the vaporetto (less than 5 minutes). Our room was big and had a good bed. Everything was clean and tidy. Breakfast was good and the wi-fi worked even in our room (though it wasn't supposed to). The staff were really kind and gentle and everybody could speak english. I'd definitely recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, simple rooms, great bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Doktorfuture
Reviews.Content: Location was great but the beds were pretty hard. We got a great rate on a room that slept four. I really loved the bathroom with its huge deep tub. Wifi worked great to Skype and was free. Breakfast is simple but free. Place is clean. It took a while for the air conditioner to cool the room and staff would turn it off when we were out. Staff is inflexible in some ways. No late check out (even 30 mins), no sitting in the breakfast area after a certain time, no using Internet during breakfast, no this, no that. It is a two star so what can one expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AnnikaWi
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Clean room with bath and air condition. Surprisingly good breakfast with fresh fruit, cheese and youghurt. The location, very close to the railway station but off the main street, is perfect too. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ammakauai
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a friend, we found the Hotel Florida to be very convenient and comfortable. It is worth it to upgrade to a "superior" room. Our room was fine, but our friends' mattress was not. Maybe they just hadn't gotten a new one in that room yet. The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable about the area and willing to spend time answering our endless questions. I think it was Claudia-she was excellent. The breakfasts were great and all in all we were glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BitterVermillion
Reviews.Content: We were traveling by train so the location was excellent. At first, as we walked down the alley way and entered the somewhat outdated lobby/reception and I was a bit skeptical about the quality of the rooms. However, our double was really nice and the bathroom was very modern. The breakfast (as others have said) is really basic. We were not disappointed and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to Venice S.L.”
Reviews.Author: banzai0
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we booked Hotel Florida since it was just one corner away from Venice Santa Lucia train station. I had my wife and two kids with me and we did not want to drag our luggages all over Venice just to get to the hotel unless we wanted to get a water taxi or water bus. We just dropped our bags in the room after getting off the train and got a few moments of rest before wandering around this charming city. The room for four people is not big, but we hardly stayed in our room anyway. It was clean and the a/c worked which were more important for us. However, we could not get wifi signal from our room so I had to go to the corridor near the stairway to connect to the internet. Breakfast was basic with coffee, cereals, pastries, and bread. But it was part of the room rate we paid so we had breakfast there twice.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: SmileyCorona
Reviews.Content: The weekend we stayed was quite warm. As soon as we walked in the hotel smelled like alley way. The people were very friendly, and the room was clean, but the room smelled and our windows opened to a roof top alley where empty kegs were being stored, adding to the smell, and allowed mosquitos into the room. Our bathroom window was boarded up (mostly) to a storage room, but the window would not completely close which added to the mosquito problem. It was ok for the value, but we stayed at Hotel Abazia (directly across from Hotel Florida) the first time we came and loved it there. I would definitely spend the extra money and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for rail travel”
Reviews.Author: AriM
Reviews.Content: Pretty good value for Venice -- would stay here again. Very convenient for rail travel. Only downside was limited hours for using wi-fi service in the mealroom area.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but the double charged my credit card.”
Reviews.Author: pedrothelion77
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for the July fireworks festival (which was amazing). This hotel was one of the few that had any vacancies left. The hotel was okay, near a livlier hub of Venice, but they ended up double charging my credit card. I had to dispute the charge, and it eventually got sorted out......but I thought it was a bit shady. Theres a really good and cheap Chineese food place around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, excellent staff, great breakfast, super location”
Reviews.Author: marshydorset
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Florida in September 2009 and found it to be as good if not better than we expected. It is in a quiet location, very close to the railway station, piazzalle roma, and the grand canal. It is located just off the Lista di Spagna and we found it to be within easy walking distance of the ghetto, rialto bridge and st marks square and many other attractions in Cannaregio, Academia etc. There is also an actv water bus stop on the grand canal, about 100 meters from the hotel entrance, (which is located down a quiet side lane off the grand canal). The hotel staff are excellent, nothing was too much trouble. They provided for my wife's special dietary needs and helped us to find the best local restaurants and the best and quickest ways to find the high lights of venice. The rooms are very clean and well serviced. We found the best way was to be out early, in the cooler conditions, (by actv), to be back for a rest in the afternoon. Then out again in the cooler part of the afternoon/evening for a gentle stroll with more sight-seeing/shopping then dinner. This hotel is ideally situated to do this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moolala
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and had a double room with ensuite. it was small but clean and it had airconditioning (very much appreciated in the heat) Our room was also very quiet as we were on the back side of the hotel. Breakfast was what we expected with coffee, bread, jam, cornflakes and yoghurt. The hotel was easy to find and convenient to buses and trains. I thought it would have been quite an effort to go any further into the heart of venice with all our bags and the crowds of people.The staff were also very friendly. Definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a relatively good value budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Florida must get 3 stars soon!”
Reviews.Author: Sk0499
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel for holidays is recommended. Firstly we (I & my wife) booked 3 nights then we decided to stay longer 6 nights because of the following: - Very good price regarding the location - Bathrooms and showers are very clean - Staff very helpful, we got a very helpful recommendation about how to spend a nice holidays in Venice, especially Mrs. Claudia â€“ we are very grateful and wish to see you soon! - Easy access from train and to water and normal bus stations - Coffee were so good - Quiet sleep during night - Nice and friendly owner. - We wished to have photos to all staff. We were shay!! Hotel Florida must get 3 stars soon! Mohamed and Hafida

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel for those on a budget who dont mind it being basic”
Reviews.Author: loup3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and whilst the room was basic, and quite small, it was perfectly adequate as a base for sightseeing. If you're looking for luxury then this probably isnâ€™t the best hotel for you, but if you are on a budget and looking for a nice hotel with friendly staff in an EXCELLENT location (not even 2 minutes walk from the main train station) then this hotel is great. The breakfast was mainly croissants and cereal, again no frills but fresh and enjoyable, despite other reviews we found the staff to all be very friendly. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, especially if you have limited time in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: librarianofbabel
Reviews.Content: If you have reservations for the train early next morning, this is the best option because it is about a block from the train station. We only had one day in Venice and it was great because we literally dropped our bags and hopped on a vaporetto, which is is right at the end of the street the hotel is on. Our train was early the next morning we literally just woke up and walked over to the train station. If I had more time in Venice, I would want to stay more inside the main part of the city, however, since I had such a limited time there, it worked out perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “the bed gave us rashes! bed bugs everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: iheart2travel18
Reviews.Content: Great Location, BAD Place! OMG!...my boyfriend and I stayed here for one night and never again! we woke up with red, itchy rashes on our face and body!!!! worse place ever!!! the second we sat on our mattress it was super old and lumpy!!! horrible experience! not worth it if you're trying to save....shell in more money and stay elsewhere!!!! it'll be worth it! this place looks like a really bad motel, it still uses keys, the linens are very dated and not clean! i had to use my pashmina to cover the pillowcase! its horrible! please dont stay here!!! the second u open your window, u can hear the waiters at a downstairs restaurant yelling at each other! horrible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would be quite happy to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Felix225
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel at the end of March together with my son, my daughter and her husband all of us experienced world travellers. We think the critical comments made by some previous guests at the hotel are unjustified. We found the rooms clean and adequate, the staff most courteous and helpful, the breakfast reasonable and the cost comparable with similar hotels in the area. Maybe the complainers were more accustomed to the massive Sheriton type hotels in the USA where one is almost drowned at breakfast with excessive quantities of weak coffee. Les Roland and Family Wokingham United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “The spirit of Venice”
Reviews.Author: SalKoonie
Reviews.Content: In seeking an economical hotel near to the cruise ship terminal, Hotel Florida was a perfect choice. Our room was clean, with its own bathroom. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, including holding our luggage the next day after we had checked out. Hotel Florida's continental breakfast is very European, and very delicious. Fresh croissants, jam, juice, cappuccino, cheese and more. A few steps from Hotel Florida's front door take you to restaurants, kiosks and shops to browse, and the vaporetto... Venice's transit system. Hotel Florida is also associated with a company who transported us from the Venice Airport at 1/3 the normal price... and our luggage was carried to the Hotel's front door! We look forward to staying again at Hotel Florida, and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Augt
Reviews.Content: Very near to the Saint Lucia train station, just around the corner once you turn left after leaving the train station, which is a plus that you don't have to tackle any bridges if you are lugging your luggage. Room was clean and breakfast was adequete. I would say that it is value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but get a room at the back”
Reviews.Author: DublinWayfarer
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 day trip to Venice staying in the Hotel Florida. We had read previouis reviews so were our expections were not high, but we really chose this hotel for the location and price given the high prices of hotels in this city. We were not dissappointed on this score as the hotel is literally around the corner from the train station and across the canal bridge from the bus station (10 minutes walk). The room we had was on the first floor overlooking the alleyway. Our first thought was to ask for a room at the back of the hotel but changed our minds as it was the only room with a little balcony and it had a nice feel to it. This proved to be a big mistake, as we discovered that this alleyway is a very busy walk through at night and early morning. A lot of high heeled ladies dragging suitcases. Also, the bells of the church chime at 7.15 and 8.15 each a.m. We had read about the bells in previous reviews and wore ear plugs and to be honest it didn't bother us as much as the noisy people outside, so the tip is to get a room at the back of the hotel. Contrary to other people's views we found the staff at reception more than helpful and advised us on a trip to Verona for a day which is a great idea. An hour and half there a back, well worth a visit. Breakfast is very, very basic, tea/coffee, yogurt, cheese slices, packet toast or white bread rolls, stale croisants and jam. For the price it could have been better and the breakfast area is very cramped. Otherwise, the room was very clean, shower and toilet adequate and plenty of wardrobe space. Pillows were thin but we had no problem getting extra ones. The water bus is only minutes away but we found that walking all the way to St. Marks square and getting lost a few times over little bridges was the best way to see Venice especially if you are snaphappy like my husband, stopping off for coffee and cakes on the way. A stunning city and everybody should go. I would recommend the Hotel Florida for the price and the super location.

Reviews.Title: “Close to station, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: RovingRich
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located literally 2 minutes walk from the train station and about 10 minutes walk from the main bus station (P. Romale). Their website provides a useful location map and the hotel is not difficult to find although down a rather narrow side street. The staff are friendly and speak English. Our room was a good size, with two single beds pushed together to make a king size. The decor was a little faded, but the room and bathroom very clean. The bathroom had a bath and shower although the former was very small. Our room on the first floor overlooked the alley outside the hotel and despite the double glazing and shutters, there was quite a lot of street noise. Added to this, there were church bells at 07.15 and 08.15 daily when we stayed there. Perhaps not the ideal hotel for light sleepers? The pillows on the bed were a little thin and not very comfortable. The room had a televsion with Italian and other TV channels. The breakfast was basic and included cereal, yoghurts, cheese, ham, crackers and bread. Various types of coffee and hot chocolate were provided on request. The hotel is relatively good value for Venice, but we found the bed uncomfortable and our room rather noisey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pretty Good Price”
Reviews.Author: maddykelly
Reviews.Content: When booking a last minute trip to Venice we came across this hotel on the priceline-europe.com website. Since we have two small kids we wanted beds to sleep all four of us, not just one big bed that we'd all cram into. They aren't big enough to warrant renting two rooms yet. When we arrived we found the hotel quite quickly - it's very close to the train station and arriving by bus is just a bit further down the canal. It's down a small alleyway that has a few restaurants and other small hotels. Also for those travelling with small kids, there is a playground not too far away. Keep going down the alley, make a right and keep walking. Our room was a good size with two twins pushed together to make a king-sized bed, and two twin trundle beds pushed up against the opposite wall for the kids. The bathroom had a toilet, shower stall, bidet and sink. One complaint was that the shower did not drain too well and even after asking a few times for it to be somehow unclogged we still had to take the fastest showers of our lives to keep the floor from flooding. There were two windows in the room which opened onto the alleyway and they had the real wood shutters that we could open and close easily to give us almost complete darkness at night, which was nice. The heater was off when we arrived and it took a while to figure out that there was a circuit 3/4 of the way up one wall that we needed to flip in order for the heater to actually heat the room. But once we switched it on, the heater was adequate for the size of the room. The room was very clean - the parquet floors were in good shape and I couldn't find any dust. They had some area rugs thrown down to soften the bare floors, but without any non-slip pads underneath I just picked them up and folded them while we were there due to them sliding around whenever anyone walked on them. There was a very very small TV up on a corner stand that we didn't even bother to turn on since it would have all been in Italian anyway. Breakfast was served from 7am and it consisted of rolls, croissants, toasts, jam, yogurt, cheese slices, and coffee. You could order cappucinos, coffee and tea, and they'd bring them to you at your table but otherwise it was self-serve. There were several water shuttle stops very close to the hotel, which we utilized a ton. Note - if you can possibly take the #2 wait the extra few minutes vs. getting on the #1 (the local...). The front desk woman who was almost always there was friendly and spoke English. We were able to check in right at 1:00pm, the earliest they list on their site as check in time. The housecleaning service did a good job each day, and we had no noisy neighbors. Only the 120+ bells that tolled at dawn every day except Sunday interrupted our sleep. All in all it was the best hotel I could find for the price. We spent 430 Euros for 4 nights on a quadruple room with private bath. All of the others I priced out were in the 500 Euro range so I was happy to save some money, which was then spent during the trip instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dcrop
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our 2 boys aged 13 & 8 all in one room so was a little squashed but expected that of most Venice hotels. Decor dated & no view from room. Location was excellent as we were traveling through Italy by train. Grand Canal at the end of the ally & lots of great restaurants in close walking distance. Reception staff OK but didn't have to use them besides check in/out. Breakfast was definatly below average, but hotel on the whole was as we expected after reading reviews

Reviews.Title: “Great stay....Great locality”
Reviews.Author: travel071
Reviews.Content: Hi......Just want to say that we stayed at the hotel between the 18th to the 21st September 2007. The room was was tastefully decorated with enough room for the bags to be rummaged through for change of clothes. The staff were very helpful and the locality was excellent. It is situated close to the train station, so you do not have to cart your luggage on the water transport system, which could be quite a pain. The only slight headache is that there is no elevator, but we stayed on the first floor so we did not have to carry our luggage up too many steps. I would definately recommend a stay at the hotel. Thanks.... Lesa & Paul

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jadrianb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so convenient to the St. Lucia train station that we almost walked right past it. My wife happened to look up and see the sign just in time. Just outside up the alley from the hotel is a water taxi station, several restaurants, shopping, and a bridge over the canal. We didn't really explore the area around it, so not sure what else it's convenient to. It was a good 20-30 minute water taxi ride around to St. Mark's Square, but that was not a problem. Our room was exactly what we were looking for: a bed and a shower close to the train station. We booked through Expedia and had a private shower, and a window overlooking a courtyard below. The staff was friendly and helpful and let us leave our bags there after we checked out. Breakfast wasn't that great, but it is a small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: st5om
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Florida for 5 nights in June 2005. Its location is fantastic, near to train station and vaporetta stops. The hotel was towards the cheaper end of the hotels available in Venice but as this was a "cheeky" extra holiday a budget was necessitated. Our room was satisfactory but we did have to share a shower - room. Facilities were kept clean however. The staff were helpful but I wouldn't say particularly friendly and the breakfast was pretty unimpressive. Venice however is beautiful with bars and restaurants in abundance. For what it is, namely an affordable hotel in the centre of Venice then you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Right for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Essenze
Reviews.Content: Location: We loved the location. Although we had no good view from our room it was close to St. Lucia Station and close to the public transportation. There were many restaurant, internet shops, laundry places, shops, ect. Room: Large room with good air-conditioning. Comfortable beds. Small TV. Not extremely clean but clean. No noise heard, peaceful. Bathroom: Not the cleanest. Very small. Low quality soap and no shampoo. Service: We were received with bottle of champaign. We checked in when we got there even though we arrived earlier than check in time. They had no iron in room nor was it available at front desk. No elevator so you had to take up your bags. Breakfast: Decent. Cereal, breads, yogurts, hot coco, coffee, tea. It was good for a European breakfast. Conclusion: Overall we liked and enjoyed the hotel and would probably stay again. The price was really good. We paid 420 euros for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great price performance”
Reviews.Author: singinggigi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel solely because of its location. It is very close to the train station. There are bars, restaurants, bank machine and pharmacy close to the hotel. I have reserved a twin room. It looked a tad small but was compensated with an extra high ceiling. The staff have been very friendly. Breakfast includes yogart, fruit juices, cornetto, somes cheese and biscotti. If you don't like the breakfast at the hotel, you can get some good tremezzino at the nearby bars. i booked directly through the hotel's website which occasionally has package deals available. One thing about the tub. It is a semi-split level tub which means it is extremely slippery . Then the bathroom door kept on opening up. Finally we had to use some brute force to close the bathroom door. The hotel does not have an elevator for the public. We lugged all our bags up the staircase. All in all, this hotel has a superb location.. It is convenient to do day trips to other towns in the veneto region.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: DaveloPreston
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here. Great position. Just a 5 minute walk from Piazzale Roma bus station. Go over the Scalzi Bridge ( which is beautiful ) and slightly to the right you will find the hotel down a narrow ginnel. Its budget but our room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. Breakfast is just coffee and a bit of bread or a croissant - but that is an Italian breakfast ! The church bells do ring at 7.15 and 8.15 am. Venice is fantastic. Explore and get lost, eat, drink and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Close to Train Station”
Reviews.Author: ytrinh
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Venice tend to be expensive but this hotel was affordable. It's very close to the train station and vaporetto stops. It was a little tricky finding it because we didn't expect it to be so close. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We asked for a triple room and we got a huge room. While the furniture was somewhat old, both the room and bathroom were clean. The breakfast was not that great. However, there were lots of great restaurants and cafes close by so we didn't really care. In general, I would recommend this hotel if you're looking for a great deal and a place close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Khatu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, near the railway station, but the brekfast that is served in the adjacent restaurant is horrible. Everything is cold. No corn flakes, or toast, cold packaged bread and an even colder attitude by the lady at the restaurant. not a really nice way of starting your day at venice. Plus points are: Next to railway station, all water buses stop on the same side as the hotel, excellent restaurants within walking distance, bus stop is 1 water bus stop away. We got a big room since we had a child with us, but the tv is old.

Reviews.Title: “handy location, friendly staff, ok on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Emmos
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time to Venice and I was trying to find a hotel room at short notice in a small budget and booked this place. While normally I wouldn't consider a two star hotel at 105 euros a night "budget", in Venice it is! Venice is probably one of the most expensive and overpriced cities in the world - I come from London, so that's saying something! Usally I prefer to stay in Mestre on the mainland which is better value. We had a double room without bathroom. The location was v easy to find - bascially its the first alley after the church on the left of the Santa Lucia train station, so no suitcases over bridges! The room had a TV, air fan unit thingie we didn't use,and two twins beds. I was v unimpressed with the free breakfast in a restaurant 2 doors along. We got there 45 mins before breakfast finished and saw the last croissant being eaten, we asked for anymore, the waitress said, "no, its too late!" - even though there was still another 45 mins to go. So we were given crackers in packets and tea - not my idea of breakfast! The staff were friendly though and spoke many languages. Just bypass the breakfast and buy your own at another cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zael
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. As others have pointed out, the rooms tend to be fairly small, but they are very well-kept with an extremely clean bathrooms. If you are a budget traveller, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. We got a special 3-day deal when booking through the hotel's website - it included a bottle of Prosecco wine as an added bonus. Sweet! The staff was extremely friendly and was very keen to assist us with things such as checking the train schedule on their computer or calling up the reception at our next hotel (they didn't speak English there). Be aware that the morning bells from the nearby Scalzi church are extremely noisy and actually ring twice on weekends (7 and 9 AM) and once on weekdays (8 AM) - I stayed only 3 days so the pattern might be different. It's not a very pleasant experience, but is rather convenient as a morning alarm ;-) Overall, if you're looking for a cheap, clean & conveniently located place in Venice, this hotel will more than satisfy you.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but...”
Reviews.Author: Moorestowners
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, the room was small, but the bed was fine - we had to catch an early train, so it was good that it was close to the station. The problem for us was we had to leave before breakfast and when the owner advised the man at the desk to get us some 'bread and cheese" we were provided hamburger buns and Kraft singles. Disappointing to say the least. But they did give us coffee. They apparently have an arrangement with a restaurant nearby for the breakfast part of their business. We were fine, but will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed here on 24th and 25th of April 2006. The location of the hotel is perfect: just three minutes walk from the train station. Although located on a narrow lane, and there are no elevators, the room was perfect for the three of us. The decor was elegant, the windows double glazed, the bathroom well appointed and everything was spotlessly clean. The triple room we stayed in had a small child's bed in a private nook. It is perfect for a small family.The breakfast was standard continental. The staff at the desk was adequately helpful and friendly. A great place to stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Book as a Last resort only!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in September. Pardon the clichÃ©, but you truly "get what you pay for". We were charged $155 Euro for a quad. There was one double bed and two twin beds. The hotel stinks. Venice smells bad enough in general, however, the hotel had its own stench. The bathroom was dirty and the bedding was stained. We walked in the rain for 1 hour looking for the hotel. Shame on us for not checking their website and just relying on their email communication for the address. There are two Calle Priuli's in Venice, one is located in a MUCH better area, however, we soon realized we were on the wrong Calle Pruili. When we arrived to check in after finally locating the hotel, the woman at the "reception" area said that ALL of the hotels in Venice are located near the train station so we should have known better. This was my third stay in Venice and I beg to differ, not all of the hotels are near the train station. Book your hotel in Venice in advance so you don't get stuck at the Hotel Florida, which for us was literally the last available hotel room in Venice the night we stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Netpopular
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Aug 3, 2005. In the middle of the night the airconditioner started dripping on the desk and woke us all up. Could not sleep. Very early in the morning the church bells started ringing. No elevator. Must drag bags up the narrow staircases.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Florida
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Priuli dei Cavalletti, 106, 30121 Venice, Italy
